comments.author: red_man150002001@yahoo.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

Flick navigation which allows you to navigate back and forward by swiping two fingers across the touch pad of a windows 7 laptop was supported in the last version before 4.0 but now no longer works.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Select a web site to navigate(any will do).
2.Navigate through a couple links within site.
3.Try flick navigating back with a flick navigation enabled laptop.
Actual Results:  
Nothing occurs.

Expected Results:  
Should navigate back just like clicking the back button.

Tried on two separate windows 7 laptops running on different internet connections, both laptops were Acer brand and worked in previous versions of Firefox.

comments.text: What do you mean by "last version before 4.0"? (4.0b13pre, 3.6.16 or something else?)
comments.author: mozilla@ahlblom.eu

comments.raw_text: What do you mean by "last version before 4.0"? (4.0b13pre, 3.6.16 or something else?)

comments.text: What's the brand of your touch pad? (Alps, Synaptics or something else?)

mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.author: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.text:
Adding answers received in private email:

"it would have been the last 3.???? version before 4.0 since I update regularly but hesitated on the 4.0 because of discovering the flick navigation issue on another computer running the beta version of 4.0"

"That would be Alps."

comments.text:
Two bugs similar to this one:
Bug 202615 - No mouse page back/forward or horizontal scroll using Alps touchpad. [not synaptics] 
Bug 605357 - Scrolling with touchpad (ALPS drivers) won't work
